snippet: While international relief workers and Philippines Department of Health workers are now scouring neighborhoods up and down the coast, they are nowhere to be seen in the interior.
abstract: International relief efforts that have mobilized in Tacloban and other coastal cities in the Philippines are nowhere to be seen in country's interior, where large numbers of injured and sick people continue to languish in aftermath of Typhoon Haiyan; local leaders describe increasing rates of fever and diarrhea, warning that no medical supplies, food, water or shelter have yet to arrive from outside.
lead_paragraph: While international relief workers and Philippines Department of Health workers are now scouring neighborhoods up and down the coast, they are nowhere to be seen in the interior.

headline.main: Inland, No Aid for Survivors of Typhoon
headline.print_headline: Typhoon Aid Slow to Reach Inland Towns
